oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1860 Colt revolver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Colt army revolver, standard model, belonged to Jefferson Casey Savage from Hardeman County, Tenn. Manufactured in Hartford, Conn., it was cut for a shoulder stock and bears the serial number 135182. According to family records, Savage joined Capt. Wilson's company in 1862, then transferred to Capt. Wiley Higgs' 2nd Co. K, 3rd (Forrest's Old) Tenn. Cav., CSA, formerly Higgs' Independent Scouts. Savage took the oath of allegiance to the United States and gave a $2000 bond on August 19, 1862.
